THO the taste for frivolity
infoslide: The 'taste for frivolity' refers to a social norm that encourages people not to take anything 'too seriously'. This expectation manifests in a demand to be ironic and entertaining, a preference for nonchalance and effortless image curation, and a stigma against earnest and formal behavior.

motion: THBT it would be unethical for you to press the button
infoslide: You are a 40-year-old, middle-income gay man, happily married to your partner for 10 years. Together, you co-own a two-bedroom apartment in Montreal's gay village and have a 5-year-old child. One day, a man contacts you with definitive proof that your husband has been cheating on you with him for over a year.Shortly after you initiate a divorce with your husband, you discover a button only you can see and press. If you press it, your current universe will be erased, and you will be transported to another universe where you had never divorced your husband and could never learn of his cheating. You would have no memory of pressing the button.

motion: THR the narrative that monetising sexuality is empowering for women
THS Vegan Terrorism
infoslide: Vegan terrorism is any act (peaceful or radical) that involves protesting against or freeing animals being reared for the sake of consumption.

motion: Assuming feasibility, THBT Po should sue Oogway
infoslide: The Dragon Scroll is a legendary scroll, written by Oogway (a legendary tortoise kung fu master) that supposedly contains the secret to 'limitless power'. Oogway declared that only the Dragon Warrior would be worthy enough to read the Dragon Scroll. Having passed tremendously difficult trials to qualify as the Dragon Warrior, Po eventually obtained the scroll. However, upon opening it, Po discovered that the scroll is just a golden reflective surface.

motion: THR the wide use of constructive ambiguity in International Law.
infoslide: Constructive ambiguity refers to the intentional use of vague language or terms in a statement or agreement to allow for multiple interpretations.

motion: THS the ghoster's law.
infoslide: The ghoster's law if passed would allow for divorce to be filed by one party without needing signatures from both partners. The only requirements for divorce would be that one party files for divorce and the other is made aware of the divorce filing.

motion: THP the life of an average monkey who lives in a resourceful jungle rather than the life of an average human being.
infoslide: An average human being is not rich neither poor. The human being needs to work, maybe overtime from time to time. May get married or not. Still may need to worry about life or something else just like you & me.A monkey in a resourceful jungle doesn't need to worry about survival that much. The chances of dying from predators are limited. The monkey has a simple intelligence that equals to the intelligence of a 5-7 years old kid.

motion: THA Job, W continue to have faith
infoslide: Job is a pious man who has no proof of God's existence or goodness, but believes all the same. As a test, God allows all of Job's children to die, all of his wealth to be lost, and his physical health to diminish. God does not offer a justification for the test, and Job is given no indication of what will happen if he continues to believe in or renounce God.

motion: THBT the Mexican government should adopt measures that enable one cartel to monopolise the drug market. (These measures can include but are not limited to: targeting enemy cartels; selective arrests; stopping military deployments to areas controlled by this cartel; and renouncing the headhunt on its current leaders.)
THA the parent, would choose the gift of intelligence rather than the gift of charisma
infoslide: You are pregnant with your first child. A fairy appears and offers to bless your unborn child with a gift of either incredible intelligence or incredible charisma. Once you have made your decision, it can not be reversed.
